trans-unit.source: Reads and writes to a named pipe in one network operation

target.mrk: Reads and writes to a named pipe in one network operation

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: The handle to the named pipe

seg-source.mrk: The handle to the named pipe

target.mrk: The handle to the named pipe

trans-unit.source: Pointer to the buffer containing the data to be written to the pipe

seg-source.mrk: Pointer to the buffer containing the data to be written to the pipe

target.mrk: Pointer to the buffer containing the data to be written to the pipe

trans-unit.source: Size of the write buffer, in bytes

seg-source.mrk: Size of the write buffer, in bytes

target.mrk: Size of the write buffer, in bytes

trans-unit.source: Pointer to the buffer that receives the data read from the pipe

seg-source.mrk: Pointer to the buffer that receives the data read from the pipe

target.mrk: Pointer to the buffer that receives the data read from the pipe

trans-unit.source: Size of the read buffer, in bytes

seg-source.mrk: Size of the read buffer, in bytes

target.mrk: Size of the read buffer, in bytes

trans-unit.source: [optional] a $tagOVERLAPPED structure.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
a $tagOVERLAPPED structure.

target.mrk: [optional]
a $tagOVERLAPPED structure.

trans-unit.source: This structure is required if $hNamedPipe was opened with $PIPE_FLAG_OVERLAPPED.

seg-source.mrk: This structure is required if $hNamedPipe was opened with $PIPE_FLAG_OVERLAPPED.

target.mrk: This structure is required if $hNamedPipe was opened with $PIPE_FLAG_OVERLAPPED.

trans-unit.source: If $hNamedPipe was opened with $PIPE_FLAG_OVERLAPPED, $tOverlapped must not be 0.

seg-source.mrk: If $hNamedPipe was opened with $PIPE_FLAG_OVERLAPPED, $tOverlapped must not be 0.

target.mrk: If $hNamedPipe was opened with $PIPE_FLAG_OVERLAPPED, $tOverlapped must not be 0.

trans-unit.source: If $hNamedPipe was opened with $PIPE_FLAG_OVERLAPPED and $tOverlapped is not 0, TransactNamedPipe is executed as an overlapped operation.

seg-source.mrk: If $hNamedPipe was opened with $PIPE_FLAG_OVERLAPPED and $tOverlapped is not 0, TransactNamedPipe is executed as an overlapped operation.

target.mrk: If $hNamedPipe was opened with $PIPE_FLAG_OVERLAPPED and $tOverlapped is not 0, TransactNamedPipe is executed as an overlapped operation.

trans-unit.source: The $tagOVERLAPPED structure should contain a manual reset event object.

seg-source.mrk: The $tagOVERLAPPED structure should contain a manual reset event object.

target.mrk: The $tagOVERLAPPED structure should contain a manual reset event object.

trans-unit.source: If the operation cannot be completed immediately, TransactNamedPipe returns False and GetLastError will return ERROR_IO_PENDING.

seg-source.mrk: If the operation cannot be completed immediately, TransactNamedPipe returns False and GetLastError will return ERROR_IO_PENDING.

target.mrk: If the operation cannot be completed immediately, TransactNamedPipe returns False and GetLastError will return ERROR_IO_PENDING.

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: the number of bytes read from the pipe.

seg-source.mrk: the number of bytes read from the pipe.

target.mrk: the number of bytes read from the pipe.

trans-unit.source: sets the @error flag to non-zero.

seg-source.mrk: sets the @error flag to non-zero.

target.mrk: sets the @error flag to non-zero.

trans-unit.source: Remarks

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: TransactNamedPipe fails if the server did not create the pipe as a message-type pipe or if the pipe handle is not in message-read mode.

seg-source.mrk: TransactNamedPipe fails if the server did not create the pipe as a message-type pipe or if the pipe handle is not in message-read mode.

target.mrk: TransactNamedPipe fails if the server did not create the pipe as a message-type pipe or if the pipe handle is not in message-read mode.
